attributes.title: Just a Friend
attributes.description: My living room is a tangle of people talking and dancing. I catch glimpses of her long brown hair, hear her full-throated laugh through the roar of voices of music. There are dozens of people at this party, but I'm fixed on her.

attributes.title: The Wedding
attributes.description: I woke up the Saturday of the wedding and wondered what it was going to be like. To see him again. I thought it might make me feel sad, or awkward. Maybe I'd feel nostalgic. Or maybe I wouldn't.

attributes.title: Through the Window
attributes.description: She took a deep breath, let it out. Outside, she imagined a world of smiling baristas, casual conversation. Inside her apartment, she languished in writer's exile. Until she caught a flicker of movement in the building across the street.

attributes.title: New Place
attributes.description: I've known you forever. As long as I can remember knowing anyone. Last year, you'd come out to LA for a night. We'd gone out, got a little touchy, but it was just short of anything, really. I walked you to the door, but we hugged goodbye. When I got home I couldn't sleep. I felt like I'd missed a turn I'd wanted to take.

attributes.title: Night One
attributes.description: Everything about it felt new. The feel of his beard on my face, his longish hair in my hands. The taste of his mouth. Reckless. Strange. Intimate.

attributes.title: Tulum
attributes.description: We walked into our treehouse villa feeling like we'd stepped into a different universe. My senses alive to the smells and sounds of the jungle and the ocean, I stripped off my clothes to head out to the sand. What use are inhibitions in paradise?
